creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: scroll has two boxes: original box is in a brown paper sleeve and contains another wooden box; box that contained scroll is a grey cardboard box; fabric is gold with a repeating floral pattern; image is a landscape with a house and fence in LR corner and a three line inscription in the UR corner
inscription: 白日衡門内　棲遲謝世氛　碩人能保壽　聖代豈期勳　古道列春樹　暮天多碧雲　客来非有約　置酒且論文 (Broad daylight at my humble home: / Here I\'ve withdrawn—farewell to the world\'s fumes! / The staunch man can preserve himself for longevity; / In sagely eras, what need to seek for fame? / The ancient Way adorns the springtime trees; / The evening sky is filled with azure clouds. / A visitor comes—we had no appointment; / I set out some wine, we discuss literature.) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #3]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō}[Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]; LLC red seal: 我有采芝齋  {wa yū saishisai}
title: Small Retreat Among Rivers and Mountains
